intro: Agave victoriae-reginae f. longifolia, commonly known as the Queen of the Night, is a rare and striking plant native to the Sierra Madre Occidental in Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, spire-like rosette of broad, blue-gray leaves with a distinctive white margin. The plant produces an impressive inflorescence that can reach up to 10 meters in height, bearing numerous white flowers that bloom only at night. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is highly sought after by collectors and conservationists alike.
